page.title: 03School System in Dundonald
page.content: In Dundonald education starts at the age of three when you start nursery school.At four and a half or five you start Primary school and you stay there until you are eleven.Then there is a selection procedure which consists of two verbal reasoning tests.Depending on the results this means that you either go to Grammar school or High School. There are no Grammar Schools in Dundonald, just the Boys High and the Girls High, so to go to Grammar school you have to go into Belfast. At sixteen you can leave school to start work or you can stay on until you are eighteen to do A levels. Depending on your results you can go on for further education to college or university.
